member.name: M:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothClient.GetStream
member.summary: Gets the underlying stream of data.
member.returns: The underlying .
member.remarks:
returns a that you can use to send and receive data. The class inherits from the class, which provides a rich collection of methods and properties used to facilitate network communications.
You must call the method first, or the method will throw an . After you have obtained the , call the method to send data to the remote host. Call the method to receive data arriving from the remote host. Both of these methods block until the specified operation is performed. You can avoid blocking on a read operation by checking the property. A true value means that data has arrived from the remote host and is available for reading. In this case, is guaranteed to complete immediately. If the remote host has shutdown its connection, will immediately return with zero bytes.
member.exception: The is not connected to a remote host.
The has been closed.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothClient.SetPin(InTheHand.Net.BluetoothAddress,System.String)
member.summary: Set or change the PIN to be used with a specific remote device.
member.param: Address of Bluetooth device.
PIN string consisting of 1-16 ASCII characters.

member.returns: Friendly name of specified device.

member.param: A .
member.returns: Returns a string value of the computer or device name.

member.exception: The has been closed.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothClient.Client
member.summary:
Gets or sets the underlying .
New in v1.4

member.name: P:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothClient.Connected
member.summary:
Gets a value indicating whether the underlying for a is connected to a remote host.
New in v1.4
member.value: true if the socket was connected to a remote resource as of the most recent operation; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothClient.Authenticate
member.summary:
Gets or sets the authentication state of the current connect or behaviour to use when connection is established.
Revised in v1.5
member.remarks: For disconnected sockets, specifies that authentication is required in order for a connect or accept operation to complete successfully. Setting this option actively initiates authentication during connection establishment, if the two Bluetooth devices were not previously authenticated. The user interface for passkey exchange, if necessary, is provided by the operating system outside the application context. For outgoing connections that require authentication, the connect operation fails with WSAEACCES if authentication is not successful. In response, the application may prompt the user to authenticate the two Bluetooth devices before connection. For incoming connections, the connection is rejected if authentication cannot be established and returns a WSAEHOSTDOWN error.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothClient.ClassOfDevice
member.summary: Returns the Class of Device for the local device.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothClient.Encrypt
member.summary:
On unconnected sockets, enforces encryption to establish a connection. Encryption is only available for authenticated connections. For incoming connections, a connection for which encryption cannot be established is automatically rejected and returns WSAEHOSTDOWN as the error. For outgoing connections, the connect function fails with WSAEACCES if encryption cannot be established. In response, the application may prompt the user to authenticate the two Bluetooth devices before connection.
Revised in v1.5

member.name: P:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothClient.HardwareStatus

member.summary: Provides a null Bluetooth address.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Bluetooth.WSAESETSERVICEOP.RNRSERVICE_REGISTER
member.summary: Register the service. For SAP, this means sending out a periodic broadcast. This is an NOP for the DNS namespace. For persistent data stores, this means updating the address information.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Bluetooth.WSAESETSERVICEOP.RNRSERVICE_DEREGISTER
member.summary: Remove the service from the registry. For SAP, this means stop sending out the periodic broadcast. This is an NOP for the DNS namespace. For persistent data stores this means deleting address information.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Bluetooth.WSAESETSERVICEOP.RNRSERVICE_DELETE
member.summary: Delete the service from dynamic name and persistent spaces. For services represented by multiple CSADDR_INFO structures (using the SERVICE_MULTIPLE flag), only the specified address will be deleted, and this must match exactly the corresponding CSADDR_INFO structure that was specified when the service was registered

member.name: T:InTheHand.Net.Bluetooth.BTHNS_INQUIRYBLOB
member.summary: This structure contains additional parameters for device inquiries.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Net.Bluetooth.BTHNS_INQUIRYBLOB.Lap
member.summary: LAP from which the inquiry access code is derived when the inquiry procedure is made.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Net.Bluetooth.BTHNS_INQUIRYBLOB.InquiryLength
member.summary: Amount of time allowed to perform the query. This value is measured in units of 1.28 seconds (time to query=length*1.28 seconds). The default value is 16.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Net.Bluetooth.BTHNS_INQUIRYBLOB.Responses
member.summary: Maximum number of devices to retrieve information about before stopping the inquiry. The default value is 16.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Bluetooth.RadioMode.Connectable

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Bluetooth.RadioMode.Discoverable

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Win32.Registry
member.summary: Supplies the base RegistryKeys that access values and subkeys in the registry.
member.remarks:
This class provides the set of standard root keys found in the registry on machines running Windows CE. The registry is a storage facility for information about applications and default system settings. For example, applications can use the registry for storing information that needs to be preserved once the application is closed, and access that same information when the application is reloaded. For instance, you can store color preferences, screen locations, or the size of the window. The keys exposed by Registry are:
CurrentUserStores information about user preferences.
LocalMachineStores configuration information for the local machine.
ClassesRootStores information about types (and classes) and their properties.
UsersStores information about the default user configuration. Once you have identified the root key under which you want to store/retrieve information from the registry, you can use the RegistryKey class to add or remove subkeys, and manipulate the values for a given key.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.Registry.LocalMachine
member.summary: Contains the configuration data for the local machine. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.Registry.CurrentUser
member.summary: Contains information about the current user preferences. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_CURRENT_USER.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.Registry.ClassesRoot
member.summary: Defines the types (or classes) of documents and the properties associated with those types. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.Registry.Users
member.summary: Contains information about the default user configuration. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_USERS.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Win32.RegistryKey
member.summary: Represents a key level node in the Windows registry. This class is a registry encapsulation.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Win32.RegistryKey.ToString
member.summary: Retrieves a string representation of this key.
member.returns: A string representing the key. If the specified key is invalid (cannot be found) then a null value is returned.
member.exception: The RegistryKey being manipulated is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Win32.RegistryKey.Flush
member.summary: Writes all the attributes of the specified open registry key into the registry.
member.remarks: The Flush method may also write out parts of or all of the other keys. Calling this function excessively can have a negative effect on an applications performance.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Win32.RegistryKey.Close
member.summary: Closes the key and flushes it to storage if the contents have been modified.
member.remarks: Calling this method on system keys will have no effect, since system keys should never be closed. This method does nothing if you call it on an instance of RegistryKey that is already closed.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Win32.RegistryKey.CreateSubKey(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new subkey or opens an existing subkey. The string subKey is not case-sensitive.
member.param: Name or path of subkey to create or open.
member.returns: Returns the subkey, or null if the operation failed.
member.exception: The specified subkey is null.
The length of the specified subkey is longer than the maximum length allowed (255 characters).
The RegistryKey on which this method is being invoked is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Win32.RegistryKey.CreateSubKey(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Creates a new subkey or opens an existing subkey. The string subKey is not case-sensitive.
New in v1.3
member.param: Name or path of subkey to create or open.
If true creates a volatile key (Requires Windows CE 5.0).
member.returns: Returns the subkey, or null if the operation failed.
member.exception: The specified subkey is null.
The length of the specified subkey is longer than the maximum length allowed (255 characters).
The RegistryKey on which this method is being invoked is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.summary: Retrieves a subkey as read-only.

member.returns: The subkey requested, or null if the operation failed.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Win32.RegistryKey.OpenSubKey(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a specified subkey.
member.param: Name or path of subkey to open.
Set to true if you need write access to the key.
member.returns: The subkey requested, or null if the operation failed.
member.exception: name is null.
The length of the specified subkey is longer than the maximum length allowed (255 characters).
The RegistryKey being manipulated is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.summary: Deletes the specified subkey. The string subkey is not case-sensitive.

The subkey is null.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Win32.RegistryKey.DeleteSubKey(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes the specified subkey. The string subkey is not case-sensitive.
member.param: Name of the subkey to delete.

Indicates whether an exception should be raised if the specified subkey cannot be found. If this argument is true and the specified subkey does not exist then an exception is raised. If this argument is false and the specified subkey does not exist, then no action is taken
member.exception: The specified subkey is not a valid reference to a registry key (and throwOnMissingSubKey is true).
The subkey is null.
The RegistryKey on which this method is being invoked is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.summary: Deletes a subkey and any child subkeys recursively. The string subKey is not case-sensitive.

member.exception: The subkey parameter is null.
Deletion of a root hive is attempted. The subkey parameter does not match a valid registry subkey.
The RegistryKey being manipulated is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Win32.RegistryValueKind
member.summary:
Specifies the data types to use when storing values in the registry, or identifies the data type of a value in the registry.
New in v1.3
member.remarks:
The RegistryValueKind enumeration defines the set of supported registry data types and the value that is used for unsupported types (Unknown).
Use the method to determine the data type of a registry key value before retrieving the value. When you set a registry key value, use the method to specify the registry data type explicitly.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.RegistryValueKind.Unknown
member.summary: Indicates an unsupported registry data type. Use this value to specify that SetValue should determine the appropriate registry data type when storing a name/value pair.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.RegistryValueKind.String
member.summary: Specifies a null-terminated string. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_SZ.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.RegistryValueKind.ExpandString
member.summary: Specifies a null-terminated string that contains unexpanded references to environment variables, such as %PATH%, that are expanded when the value is retrieved. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_EXPAND_SZ.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.RegistryValueKind.Binary
member.summary: Specifies binary data in any form. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_BINARY.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.RegistryValueKind.DWord
member.summary: Specifies a 32-bit binary number. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_DWORD.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Win32.RegistryValueKind.MultiString
member.summary: Specifies an array of null-terminated strings, terminated by two null characters. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_MULTI_SZ.

member.summary: Listens for connections from Bluetooth network clients.
member.remarks: The class provides simple methods that listen for and accept incoming connection requests in blocking synchronous mode. You can use either a or a to connect with a

Initializes a new instance of the class.
New in v1.5

Prepared SDP Record to publish
Offset into the SDP record in which to place the actual channel.
member.remarks: It is recommended that you use the alternative constructor which takes just a service guid for your custom profile implementations.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothListener.Start
member.summary: Starts the socket to listen for incoming connections.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothListener.Stop
member.summary: Stops the socket from monitoring connections.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothListener.AcceptSocket
member.summary: Creates a new socket for a connection.
member.remarks:
AcceptSocket is a blocking method that returns a that you can use to send and receive data. If you want to avoid blocking, use the method to determine if connection requests are available in the incoming connection queue.
The returned is initialized with the address and channel number of the remote device. You can use any of the Send and Receive methods available in the class to communicate with the remote device. When you are finished using the , be sure to call its method. If your application is relatively simple, consider using the method rather than the AcceptSocket method. provides you with simple methods for sending and receiving data over a network in blocking synchronous mode.
member.returns: A used to send and receive data.
member.exception: Listener is stopped.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothListener.AcceptBluetoothClient
member.summary: Creates a client object for a connection when the specified service or endpoint is detected by the listener component.
member.remarks:
AcceptTcpClient is a blocking method that returns a that you can use to send and receive data. Use the method to determine if connection requests are available in the incoming connection queue if you want to avoid blocking.
Use the method to obtain the underlying of the returned . The will provide you with methods for sending and receiving with the remote host. When you are through with the , be sure to call its method. If you want greater flexibility than a offers, consider using .
member.returns: A component.
member.exception: Listener is stopped.

member.name: M:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothListener.Pending
member.summary: Determines if there is a connection pending.
member.returns: true if there is a connection pending; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothListener.LocalEndPoint
member.summary: Gets the underlying of the current .

member.name: P:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothListener.Server
member.summary:
Gets the underlying network .
New in v1.4
member.remarks:
creates a to listen for incoming client connection requests. Classes deriving from can use this property to get this . Use the underlying returned by the property if you require access beyond that which provides.
Note property only returns the used to listen for incoming client connection requests. Use the method to accept a pending connection request and obtain a for sending and receiving data. You can also use the method to accept a pending connection request and obtain a for sending and receiving data.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName
member.summary: Defines configuration option names for the class when used with Bluetooth.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.Authenticate
member.summary: On connected socket, triggers authentication. On not connected socket, forces authentication on connection. For incoming connection this means that connection is rejected if authentication cannot be performed.
member.remarks: The optval and optlen parameters are ignored; however, Winsock implementation on Windows CE requires optlen to be at least 4 and optval to point to at least an integer datum.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.XPAuthenticate
member.summary:
Toggles authentication under Windows XP.
New in v1.5
member.remarks: optlen=sizeof(ULONG), optval = &(ULONG)TRUE/FALSE

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.Encrypt
member.summary: On a connected socket, this command turns encryption on or off. On an unconnected socket, this forces encryption to be on or off on connection. For an incoming connection, this means that the connection is rejected if the encryption cannot be turned on.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.SetPin
member.summary: This sets or revokes PIN code to use with a connection or socket.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.SetLink
member.summary: This sets or revokes link key to use with a connection or peer device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetLink
member.summary: Returns link key associated with peer Bluetooth device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.XPMtu
member.summary:
Get or set the default MTU on Windows XP.
New in v1.5
member.remarks: optlen=sizeof(ULONG), optval = &mtu

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.SetMtu
member.summary: This sets default MTU (maximum transmission unit) for connection negotiation. While allowed for connected socket, it has no effect if the negotiation has already completed. Setting it on listening socket will propagate the value for all incoming connections.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetMtu
member.summary: Returns MTU (maximum transmission unit). For connected socket, this is negotiated value, for server (accepting) socket it is MTU proposed for negotiation on connection request.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.XPMtuMaximum
member.summary:
Get or set the maximum MTU on Windows XP.
New in v1.5
member.remarks: optlen=sizeof(ULONG), optval = &max. mtu

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.SetMtuMaximum
member.summary: This sets maximum MTU for connection negotiation. While allowed for connected socket, it has no effect if the negotiation has already completed. Setting it on listening socket will propagate the value for all incoming connections.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetMtuMaximum
member.summary: Returns maximum MTU acceptable MTU value for a connection on this socket. Because negotiation has already happened, has little meaning for connected socket.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.XPMtuMinimum
member.summary:
Get or set the minimum MTU on Windows XP.
New in v1.5
member.remarks: optlen=sizeof(ULONG), optval = &min. mtu

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.SetMtuMinimum
member.summary: This sets minimum MTU for connection negotiation. While allowed for connected socket, it has no effect if the negotiation has already completed. Setting it on listening socket will propagate the value for all incoming connections.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetMtuMinimum
member.summary: Returns minimum MTU acceptable MTU value for a connection on this socket. Because negotiation has already happened, has little meaning for connected socket.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.SetXOnLimit
member.summary: This sets XON limit. Setting it on listening socket will propagate the value for all incoming connections.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetXOnLimit
member.summary: Returns XON limit for a connection. XON limit is only used for peers that do not support credit-based flow control (mandatory in the Bluetooth Core Specification version 1.1). When amount of incoming data received, but not read by an application for a given connection grows past this limit, a flow control command is sent to the peer requiring suspension of transmission.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.SetXOffLimit
member.summary: This sets XOFF limit. Setting it on listening socket will propagate the value for all incoming connections.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetXOffLimit
member.summary: Returns XOFF limit for a connection. XOFF limit is only used for peers that do not support credit-based flow control (mandatory in the Bluetooth Core Specification 1.1). If flow has been suspended because of buffer run-up, when amount of incoming data received, but not read by an application for a given connection falls below this limit, a flow control command is sent to the peer allowing continuation of transmission.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.SetSendBuffer
member.summary: Specifies maximum amount of data that can be buffered inside RFCOMM (this is amount of data before call to send blocks).

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetSendBuffer
member.summary: Returns maximum amount of data that can be buffered inside RFCOMM (this is amount of data before call to send blocks).

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.SetReceiveBuffer
member.summary: Specifies maximum amount of data that can be buffered for a connection. This buffer size is used to compute number of credits granted to peer device when credit-based flow control is implemented. This specifies the maximum amount of data that can be buffered.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetReceiveBuffer
member.summary: Returns maximum amount of data that can be buffered for a connection. This buffer size is used to compute number of credits granted to peer device when credit-based flow control is implemented. This specifies the maximum amount of data that can be buffered.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetV24Break
member.summary: Retrieves last v24 and break signals set through MSC command from peer device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetRls
member.summary: Retrieves last line status signals set through RLS command from peer device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.SendMsc
member.summary: Sends MSC command. V24 and breaks are as specified in RFCOMM Specification. Only modem signals and breaks can be controlled, RFCOMM reserved fields such as flow control are ignored and should be set to 0.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.SendRls
member.summary: Sends RLS command. Argument is as specified in RFCOMM Specification.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetFlowType
member.summary: Gets flow control type on the connected socket.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.SetPageTimeout
member.summary: Sets the page timeout for the card. The socket does not have to be connected.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetPageTimeout
member.summary: Gets the current page timeout. The socket does not have to be connected.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.SetScan
member.summary: Sets the scan mode for the card. The socket does not have to be connected.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetScan
member.summary: Gets the current scan mode. The socket does not have to be connected.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.SetCod
member.summary: Sets the class of the device. The socket does not have to be connected.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetCod
member.summary: Retrieve the Class of Device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetLocalVersion
member.summary: Get the version information from the Bluetooth adapter.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetRemoteVersion
member.summary: Get the version of the remote adapter.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetAuthenticationEnabled
member.summary: Retrieves the authentication settings. The socket does not have to be connected.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.SetAuthenticationEnabled
member.summary: Sets the authentication policy of the device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.ReadRemoteName
member.summary: Reads the remote name of the device. The socket does not have to be connected.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetLinkPolicy
member.summary: Retrieves the link policy of the device.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.SetLinkPolicy
member.summary: Sets the link policy for an existing baseband connection. The socket must be connected.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionName.GetMode
member.summary: Gets the current mode of the connection. The mode can either be sniff, park, or hold. The socket must be connected.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothSocketOptionLevel
member.summary: Defines Bluetooth specific socket option levels for the and methods.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothProtocolType
member.summary: Specifies the Bluetooth specific protocols that the class supports.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothProtocolType.Sdp
member.summary: Service Discovery Protocol

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothProtocolType.Obex
member.summary: Object Exchange

member.name: T:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothAddressFamily
member.summary: Specifies the Bluetooth specific addressing scheme that an instance of the class can use.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Sockets.BluetoothAddressFamily.Bluetooth
member.summary: Bluetooth address.

member.name: T:InTheHand.IO.Ports.BluetoothSerialPort
member.summary: Represents a virtual COM port.

member.name: M:InTheHand.IO.Ports.BluetoothSerialPort.CreateServer(System.String,System.Int32,System.Guid)
member.summary: Create a virtual server port to listen for incoming connections.
member.param: Port name prefix e.g. "COM"
Port index e.g. 5
Bluetooth service.

member.name: M:InTheHand.IO.Ports.BluetoothSerialPort.CreateClient(System.String,System.Int32,InTheHand.Net.BluetoothEndPoint)
member.summary: Create a client port for connection to a remote device.
member.param: Port name prefix e.g. "COM"
Port index e.g. 5
Remote device to connect to
member.returns: A BluetoothSerialPort.

member.name: M:InTheHand.IO.Ports.BluetoothSerialPort.Close
member.summary: Closes the virtual serial port releasing all resources.

member.name: P:InTheHand.IO.Ports.BluetoothSerialPort.PortName
member.summary: The full representation of the port name e.g. "COM5:"

member.name: P:InTheHand.IO.Ports.BluetoothSerialPort.Address
member.summary: The address of the remote device to which this port will connect (Client Ports only).

member.name: P:InTheHand.IO.Ports.BluetoothSerialPort.Service
member.summary: The Bluetooth service to connect to.

member.name: P:InTheHand.IO.Ports.BluetoothSerialPort.PortIndex
member.summary: Port index.

member.name: P:InTheHand.IO.Ports.BluetoothSerialPort.Local
member.summary: Specifies whether the port is a local service or for outgoing connections.
member.value: TRUE for a server port that accepts connections, or to FALSE for a client port that is used to creating outgoing connections.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Net.Bluetooth.BTHNS_RESULT
member.summary: Bluetooth specific flags returned from WSALookupServiceNext in WSAQUERYSET.dwOutputFlags in response to device inquiry.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Net.Bluetooth.BLUETOOTH_FIND_RADIO_PARAMS
member.summary: The BLUETOOTH_FIND_RADIO_PARAMS structure facilitates enumerating installed Bluetooth radios.

member.name: T:InTheHand.Net.Bluetooth.HardwareStatus
member.summary: Specifies the current status of the Bluetooth hardware.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Bluetooth.HardwareStatus.Unknown
member.summary: Status cannot be determined.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Bluetooth.HardwareStatus.NotPresent
member.summary: Bluetooth radio not present.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Bluetooth.HardwareStatus.Initializing
member.summary: Bluetooth radio is in the process of starting up.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Bluetooth.HardwareStatus.Running
member.summary: Bluetooth radio is active.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Bluetooth.HardwareStatus.Shutdown
member.summary: Bluetooth radio is in the process of shutting down.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.Bluetooth.HardwareStatus.Error
member.summary: Bluetooth radio is in an error state.

member.summary: Specifies the minimum value that can be assigned to the Port property.

member.name: F:InTheHand.Net.BluetoothEndPoint.MaxPort

The Bluetooth service to use.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified address, service and port number.

The Bluetooth service to use.
Radio channel to use, -1 for any.
